articles.title: Kim Yong Nam Meets Chinese NPC Delegation
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Meets Chinese NPC Delegation
 Pyongyang, December 3 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, met and had a friendly talk with the delegation of the Chinese National People's Congress led by Chen Zhili, vice-chairwoman of its Standing Committee, when she paid a courtesy call on him at the Mansudae Assembly Hall Thursday.
					 Saying that the functions held in this year, the "Year of DPRK-China Friendship", clearly proved that the DPRK-China friendship is unbreakable and solid, Kim Yong Nam underlined the need to boost the friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries.
					
					 Chen Zhili wished the Korean people greater success in their efforts to open the gate to a great prosperous and powerful nation, saying they would make positive efforts to develop the friendly and cooperative relations with the DPRK.
					
					 On hand were Hong Son Ok, vice-chairwoman of the Supreme People's Assembly, officials concerned and Liu Xiaoming, Chinese ambassador to the DPRK.

articles.title: Gift from Chinese NPC Delegation
articles.content:
Gift from Chinese NPC Delegation
 Pyongyang, December 3 (KCNA) -- General Secretary Kim Jong Il was presented with a gift by the Chinese National People's Congress.
					 The gift was handed to Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly, by Chen Zhili, vice-chairwoman of the Standing Committee of the Chinese National People's Congress, on a visit to the DPRK on Thursday.

articles.title: Yang Hyong Sop Meets Ugandan Government Delegation
articles.content:
Yang Hyong Sop Meets Ugandan Government Delegation
Pyongyang, December 3 (KCNA) -- Yang Hyong Sop, vice-president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly, met and had a friendly talk with the Ugandan government delegation headed by Namuyangu Kachya Jenipher Byakatonda, minister of State for Water of the Ministry of Water and Environment, at the Mansudae Assembly Hall Thursday. 
					 Present there were Ri Song Uk, vice-president of the State Academy of Sciences, and officials concerned.

articles.title: Chairman of Intl Kim Il Sung Foundation Here
articles.content:
Chairman of Intl Kim Il Sung Foundation Here
 Pyongyang, December 3 (KCNA) -- Johnny Hon, chairman of the International Kim Il Sung Foundation, arrived here on Thursday.

articles.title: Seminar on Drug Management and Control Held
articles.content:
Seminar on Drug Management and Control Held
 Pyongyang, December 3 (KCNA) -- The National Seminar on Drug Management and Control was held at the People's Palace of Culture from Dec. 1 through 3.
					 Present there were officials of the National Coordinating Committee of the DPRK for Drug Control, ministries and national institutions, officials concerned and members of the delegation of the International Narcotics Control Board.
					
					 The representative of the WHO here was present there on invitation.
					
					 Ri Pong Hun, vice-minister of Public Health, in his opening address said that illegal manufacture and traffic in narcotic drug and psychotropic substances cause serious problems in various countries as they spawn all kinds of crimes and seriously harm people's health.
					
					 The DPRK has intensified drug management and control in order to prevent drug-borne social danger in advance and provide people with an independent and creative life.
					
					 Koli Kouame, head of the delegation of the International Narcotics Control Board, speaking at the seminar said that the DPRK has achieved great successes in drug management and control.
					
					 Lectures were given under the theme of "1961 Single Convention on Narcotic Drugs", "1971 Convention on Psychotropic Substances" and "1988 UN Convention against Illicit Traffic in Narcotic Drugs and Psychotropic Substances".
					
					 Other speakers called for intensifying drug management and control now that drug smuggling and abuses are not eliminated worldwide.
					
					 They stressed the need for the officials in the field of drug management and control to enhance their responsibility and role.

articles.title: Mosaics Erected at Several Units
articles.content:
Mosaics Erected at Several Units
Pyongyang, December 3 (KCNA) -- Mosaics depicting President Kim Il Sung and General Secretary Kim Jong Il were erected at several units.
					 Officials and working people erected mosaics "The Great Leader Comrade Kim Il Sung Will Always Be with Us" in Tonghungsan District, Hamhung City, South Hamgyong Province, Phangyo County of Kangwon Province and Sinsong-ri, Singye County of North Hwanghae Province.
					
					 A mosaic erected in Kaechon City of South Phyongan Province portrays the courageous appearance of young Kim Il Sung crossing the River Amnok with his firm pledge to liberate at any cost the country usurped by the Japanese imperialists.
					
					 Erected at the Chollima Steel Complex was mosaic "The Great Leader Comrade Kim Il Sung among Workers of the Blooming Shop".
					
					 A mosaic standing in Tokchon City of South Phyongan Province depicts Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il picturing to themselves the morrow of a richer and more prosperous country atop Mt. Paektu, a holy mountain of the revolution.
					
					 A mosaic erected at the Panmunjom Co-op Farm of Kaesong City successfully portrays kind-hearted Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il smiling all over their faces while feasting their eyes on co-op fields visited by bumper crops.

articles.title: Newly Developed Lift Pump
articles.content:
Newly Developed Lift Pump
 Pyongyang, December 3 (KCNA) -- A lift pump recently developed and manufactured by the State Academy of Sciences of the DPRK has been well received by users.
					 The pump lifts water by making use of water hammer action occurring when the water flow stops in the pipe in a moment.
					
					 It, which is also called "hydraulic pump", is simple in structure and easy in manufacture and, once installed, can be used for a long time.
					
					 It is available at any places with over 1 meter head of water and can lift water up to dozens of meters without electricity or fuel.
					
					 The pump has already been introduced by several units, profusely paying off.

articles.title: Successes in Preserving Historical Relics
articles.content:
Successes in Preserving Historical Relics
 Pyongyang, December 3 (KCNA) -- Efforts for preserving historical relics and remains have been made successfully in the Democratic People's Republic of Korea. 
					In this autumn alone, seven old forts and over 70 tombs have been reportedly restored to the original state, natural monuments preserved in their origin and ancient buildings and facilities for preserving culture repaired or newly installed in some 1,170 places and more than 130,000 trees of good species planted in beauty spots and historical sites throughout the country.
					
					As part of efforts to turn Sokam, a scenic spot, in Phyongwon County, South Phyongan Province into a better sight-seeing resort, a more than 1,000 meters long embankment project and the construction of a lake of 250 square meters have been finished successfully in a short period of time. And a large number of trees have been planted there.
					
					 Streams in Phaldam and Tanphung ravines in Mt. Kuwol in South Hwanghae Province have been revetted well. In North Hwanghae Province, the house of preserving a dinosaur's fossil footprints and the Thaebaeksan Fort have been restored or reconstructed in Phyongsan County and the Pogwang Pavilion of the Simwon Temple in Yonthan County repainted in red and blue colors to change the appearance of the relic.
					
					 In Kangwon Province the Pulji Temple in Kumgang County has been restored on a large scale and Sagi Stream flowing in front of the Sokwang Temple readjusted in a qualitative way to prevent flood damage.
					
					 In South Hamgyong Province the main building and Pogwang Pavilion of the Kwangje Temple in Pukchong County and the Pulji Temple in Yonggwang County have had their roofs, walls, floors, doors and other parts of the buildings repaired and repainted colorfully to suit the characteristics of historical buildings.
					
					 The campaign for preserving historical relics and remains organized in the country every year serves as an occasion for maintaining nationality and implanting a strong sense of patriotism into the hearts of the people.

articles.title: Dolmens Telling of Ancient Korea's Capital
articles.content:
Dolmens Telling of Ancient Korea's Capital
 Pyongyang, December 3 (KCNA) -- It is well known that the basin of the Taedong River with Pyongyang as the center was a hub of the ancient culture. It is proved by the fact that dolmens representing the culture of Tangun's Korea were distributed in the area densely and in great numbers.
					Many dolmens find themselves in most areas of the Korean peninsula and some northeast areas of China. In particular, as many as 14,000 dolmens have been discovered in and around Pyongyang.
					
					 Not a small number of groups, each consisting of 300-600 dolmens, have been found out in Pyongyang and its vicinity.
					
					 In the Taedong River basin, there are all kinds of dolmens ranging from old-typed to latest-typed ones belonging to different periods, such as Chimchon-ri dolmen and Odok-ri dolmen.
					
					 This area has much more extra-large dolmens for royal families than other areas.
					
					 Many of them have top stones with a size of over 50 square meters and weight of 80-100 tons and chambers with a height of 2.5-2.7 meters.
					
					 Typical ones are in Jang-ri, Sangwon County, Pyongyang, in Songmae-ri (before Odok-ri), Yonthan County, North Hwanghae Province and in Kwansan-ri, Unryul County and Roam-ri, Anak County, South Hwanghae Province.
					
					 The concentrated distribution of such large-sized dolmens in and around Pyongyang shows clearly that many people of power and wealth had lived in the area at that time and, consequently, Pyongyang had not only been the capital of Tangun's Korea but also been a hub of culture in the period of ancient Korea.

articles.title: GNP's Anti-DPRK "Human Rights" Racket under Fire
articles.content:
GNP's Anti-DPRK "Human Rights" Racket under Fire
 Pyongyang, December 3 (KCNA) -- The group of the Grand National Party of south Korea has recently rammed what it called the "bill on human rights in the north" through the "Sub-Committee for Examination of Bills of the Diplomatic, Trade and Unification Committee of the National Assembly". It is now working hard to have it formally adopted as  a "law" at the session of the NA a few days later in conspiracy with the "Liberal Progressive Party", an ultra-right conservative party.
					 Papers Thursday observe in signed commentaries in this regard:
					
					 The above-said move is an unpardonable politically motivated provocation against the DPRK as it was prompted by a sinister intention to tarnish the image of the dignified socialist system in the DPRK and escalate confrontation of systems into an extreme pitch.
					
					 Rodong Sinmun notes that the DPRK is a genuine country for the people as it regards the popular masses as the master of the state and society and makes everything serve them, fully embodying the immortal Juche idea in the nation-building and social activities. To dare speak ill of it is no more than a reckless act of those who do not know what genuine human rights are like. The paper goes on:
					
					 It is preposterous and shameless for the GNP group to take issue with "human rights" issue of someone as they are the criminals who have ruthlessly abused human rights by enforcing a fascist rule over the people. 
					
					 The ever-more undisguised anti-DPRK "human rights" racket on the part of the puppets in south Korea is a revelation of their ruling crisis.
					
					 The south Korean ruling forces should immediately stop the above-said racket aimed at escalating confrontation and tension.
					
					 Minju Joson warns that the  desperate efforts to railroad the "bill on human rights in the north" through the session of the NA at any cost bring into bolder relief the treacherous nature of those puppets seeking a way-out in escalating the inter-Korean confrontation and thus result in further deepening their ruling crisis.

articles.title: Anniversary of South Headquarters of Pomminryon Marked
articles.content:
Anniversary of South Headquarters of Pomminryon Marked
 Pyongyang, December 3 (KCNA) -- The South Headquarters of the Pan-national Alliance for Korea's Reunification (Pomminryon) held a meeting in Pusan of south Korea on Nov. 29 to mark the 19th anniversary of its formation.
					 Present at the meeting were members of the headquarters and political parties and civic and public organizations and other people of different strata.
					
					 Speeches were made by Chairman Ri Kyu Jae, Secretary General Ri Kyong Won and Chairwoman of the Publicity Committee Choe Un A of the headquarters, who were released after being detained on the charge of violation of the "National Security Law".
					
					 Noting that they cherished the spirit of the June 15 joint declaration more deeply while suffering persecution in the prison before, the speakers declared their will to sacrifice their lives in the future struggle to defend and implement the inter-Korean declarations.
					
					 The movement for national reunification is steadily advancing despite the persistent obstruction by the present "government", they said, calling upon the progressive forces to unite and give strong counterattack to the anti-reunification racket of the authorities.
					
					 Solidarity addresses were also made at the meeting.
					
					 And congratulatory messages from the north and overseas headquarters of Pomminryon were introduced before a joint resolution of Pomminryon was read out.

articles.title: S. Korean Police Put down Trade Union
articles.content:
S. Korean Police Put down Trade Union
 Pyongyang, December 3 (KCNA) -- The south Korean puppet police searched the office of the Government Employees' Union in Yongdungpho, Seoul, on Dec. 1, according to south Korean KBS.
					 The police took such repressive action on charges of violating the "law on government employees", claiming that the chairman and other leading members of the union led the action for making public declarations on the situation and participated in the rally called by the south Korean Confederation of Trade Unions last month.
					
					 Earlier, the puppet Ministry of Administration and Security announced that it would not recognize the Government Employees' Union as a legal organization and seize its 53 branch offices until Friday.

articles.title: Kim Jong Suk's Exploits Lauded in Peru
articles.content:
Kim Jong Suk's Exploits Lauded in Peru
 Pyongyang, December 3 (KCNA) -- The Peruvian People's Women Union issued its bulletin titled "Kim Jong Suk" on Nov. 27 on the occasion of her 92nd birth anniversary.
					 The bulletin in an article noted that Kim Jong Suk, anti-Japanese heroine, devoted her all to the liberation of Korea, the building of a new country and the victory of the revolution while positively assisting President Kim Il Sung.
					
					 It said:
					
					 Her greatest exploit is that she gave steady continuity to the revolutionary cause of Juche pioneered by the President.
					
					As required by her, General Secretary Kim Jong Il has firmly defended socialism in the DPRK, bringing about a new era of building a great prosperous and powerful socialist nation.
					
					 Kim Jong Suk, comrade-in-arms most faithful to Kim Il Sung and great mother of the Korean people, will be always alive in their hearts and her august name will shine in the history of the country.

articles.title: DPRK Important Days Observed in Different Countries
articles.content:
DPRK Important Days Observed in Different Countries 
Pyongyang, December 3 (KCNA) -- A seminar on exploits of the three commanders of Mt. Paektu and a photo exhibition were held in the Czech Republic and film shows in Russia and Singapore from Nov. 20 to 26 on the occasions of the 18th anniversary of General Secretary Kim Jong Il's assumption of the supreme commandership of the Korean People's Army and the 92nd birth anniversary of Kim Jong Suk, anti-Japanese heroine.
					 Displayed in the venues of the functions were photos on the DPRK winning one victory after another under the banner of Songun.
					
					 The chairman of the Sixth District of Prague City Committee of the Communist Party of Czech and Moravia said that Kim Jong Il, general secretary of the Workers' Party of Korea, formulated the Songun politics as the main political mode of socialism to cope with the changed situation and has thoroughly embodied it.
					
					 The Korean revolution was started under the leadership of President Kim Il Sung, father of socialist Korea, he noted, referring to the undying exploits performed by the President and Kim Jong Il.
					
					 The Korean people are waging the general advance for opening the gate to a great prosperous and powerful nation by 2012, the centenary of birth of the President, he said, adding: 
					
					 This is to realize the desire of Kim Jong Suk to build a rich and powerful country in Korea.
					
					 After watching a film, the general manager of the "Gem Mash" Company and the deputy director of the Neutron Physical Field Station of the Dubna International United Nuclear Institute of Russia expressed belief that the Korean people would achieve greater success in their efforts to make the appearance of the country more beautiful under the wise leadership of Kim Jong Il.

articles.title: Centenary of Kim Il Sung's Birth to Be Observed in Bulgaria
articles.content:
Centenary of Kim Il Sung's Birth to Be Observed in Bulgaria
 Pyongyang, December 3 (KCNA) -- A Bulgarian preparatory committee for commemorating the centenary of birth of President Kim Il Sung was inaugurated on November 24.
					  The chairman of the Veteran Federation of the Bulgarian Socialist Party who is member of the Executive Bureau of the National Council of the Party was elected chairman of the preparatory committee.
					
					 The preparatory committee discussed the matter of working out the phased action program for significantly commemorating the above-said anniversary and thoroughly carrying it into practice.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il recibe presente de delegacion de APN de RPCh
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il recibe presente de delegacion de APN de RPCh
Pyongyang, 3 de diciembre (ATCC) -- El Dirigente Kim Jong Il recibio presente que le dirigiera la Asamblea Popular Nacional de la Republica Popular China.
					La vicepresidenta del Comite Permanente de la APN de la RPCh, Chen Zhili, de visita en Corea, lo entrego el dia 3 al presidente del Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, Kim Yong Nam.

articles.title: Efectuado Seminario Nacional sobre Administracion y Control de Droga
articles.content:
Efectuado Seminario Nacional sobre Administracion y Control de Droga
Pyongyang, 3 de diciembre (ATCC) -- Tuvo lugar del dia primero al 3 en el Palacio Cultural del Pueblo el Seminario Nacional sobre la Administracion y el Control de Droga.
					En la ocasion estuvieron presentes los funcionarios del Comite de Coordinacion Nacional de Control de Droga de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, ministerios, organos centrales y otros interesados, asi como los miembros de la delegacion del Consejo Internacional del Control de Narcoticos (CICN).
					
					Fue invitado alli el delegado de la Organizacion Mundial de la Salud.
					
					El viceministro coreano de Salud Publica Ri Pong Hun, en el discurso de apertura, se refirio a que la fabricacion y la transaccion ilegales de droga y los materiales excitantes a la mente, que causan los crimenes de diversos generos y dan gran dano a la salud de las personas, se presentan en diversos paises del mundo como serio problema.
					
					Destaco que en Corea se intensifica la labor de la administracion y el control de droga a fin de prevenir el peligro social causado por la droga y ofrecer a los habitantes la vida independiente y creadora.
					
					En su discurso el jefe de la delegacion del CICN, Koli Kouame senalo que la RPDC logra mayores exitos en la labor de esta rama.
					
					Y en la ocasion hubo lecciones con temas del "Convenio unico de 1961 sobre la droga", el "Convenio de 1971 sobre los materiales excitantes a la mente" y el "Convenio de la ONU de 1988 contra el transaccion ilegal de la droga y los materiales excitantes a la mente".
					
					En sus intervenciones los oradores subrayaron la necesidad de fortalecer la administracion y el control de droga en las condiciones en que no se eliminan en escala mundial el contrabando y el abuso de la droga.
					
					Senalaron la importancia de elevar la responsabilidad y el papel de los funcionarios de la rama de administracion y control de la droga.

articles.title: Periodicos denuncian la campana anti-RPDC del "GPN"
articles.content:
Periodicos denuncian la campana anti-RPDC del "GPN"
Pyongyang, 3 de diciembre (ATCC) -- Hace poco, los compinches del "Gran Partido Nacional" del Sur de Corea aprobaron el llamado "proyecto de ley de derechos humanos del Norte" en el "Subcomite de Examen de los Proyectos de Ley del Comite de Relaciones Exteriores, Comercio y Reunificacion de la Asamblea Nacional" e intentan instituir oficialmente unos dias despues esa ley en la reunion ordinaria de la "Asamblea Nacional" en contubernio con el ultraderechista y conservador "Partido Progresivo Liberal".
					En sendos comentarios individuales difundidos el dia 3, los periodicos capitalinos denunciaron la aprobacion del proyecto en cuestion en la "Asamblea Nacional" titere del Sur de Corea calificandola de imperdonable provocacion politica contra la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, que parte del malsano intento de mellar la imagen del digno regimen socialista de ella y exacerbar al extremo la confrontacion entre regimenes.
					
					La RPDC es verdadero pais del pueblo que presenta a las masas populares como duenas del Estado y la sociedad y sirve a ellas materializando consecuentemente la inmortal idea Juche en la construccion del Estado y las actividades sociales, comienza el diario Rodong Sinmun y continua:
					
					Sin embargo, se atreven a calumniarla esos ignorantes que no saben lo que son los autenticos derechos humanos.
					
					Resulta absurdo y cinico que los que cuestionan los "derechos humanos" de alguien son esos criminales que los violan flagrantemente practicando la dominacion fascista sobre los habitantes.
					
					La cada dia mas brutal campana anti-RPDC en el campo de DDHH, que libran los titeres surcoreanos, es la expresion de la crisis de gobernacion en que cayeron.
					
					Las fuerzas gobernantes del Sur de Corea deben parar ahora mismo esa campana que fomenta la confrontacion y la tension.
					
					Por su parte, el periodico Minju Joson senala que la intencion de los titeres surcoreanos de aprobar a toda costa en la reunion ordinaria de la "Asamblea Nacional" la "ley de derechos humanos del Norte" es una muestra contundente de la naturaleza vendepatria de ellos que buscan la manera de su subsistencia en la confrontacion Norte-Sur y advierte que esto agudizara aun mas la crisis de gobernacion.

articles.title: Exitos logrados en conservacion de reliquias historicas
articles.content:
Exitos logrados en conservacion de reliquias historicas
						
Pyongyang, 3 de diciembre (ATCC) -- Se lograron muchos exitos en Corea en la campana para conservar y cuidar las reliquias historicas que se libra en etapa crucial.
					Segun las estadisticas disponibles, solo en la estacion otonal de este ano, se repararon en el ambito nacional in statu quo 7 castillos antiguos y mas de 70 tumbas.
					
					Ademas, en mas de mil 170 lugares de interes historico se realizan los trabajos para conservar los patrimonios naturales y terminaron la gran reparacion de las reliquias historicas, la colocacion y el mantenimiento de las instalaciones para proteger los bienes culturales.
					
					Mientras tanto, se plantaron mas de 130 mil arboles de buena variedad en los lugares famosos y las zonas fijadas para la proteccion de las ruinas.
					
					Para acondicionar el lugar famoso de Sok-am del distrito de Phyongwon como mejor sitio de descanso cultural del pueblo, en la provincia de Phyong-an del Sur se desarrollo en un corto plazo la construccion de la escollera empedrada en un tramo de mas de mil metros y de una laguna artificial de 250 metros cuadrados y se sembraron muchos arboles.
					
					En las provincias de Hwanghae del Sur y del Norte fueron ordenadas magnificamente las riberas de los riachuelos en los valles Phaldam y Tanphung del monte Kuwol.
					
					Igualmente, se llevaron a cabo la reconstruccion y la reparacion sobre el museo de conservacion del fosil de la pisada de dinosaurio y el castillo del monte Thaebaek del distrito de Phyongsan y fue renovada la fisonomia de la Capilla Pogwang del Templo Simwon del distrito de Yonthan al terminarse con exito el repinte de Tanchong.
					
					Y en la provincia de Kangwon se reparo la Ermita Pulji del distrito de Kumgang y termino con calidad la construccion del dique en el riachuelo Sagi del Templo Sokwang para proteger las ruinas y las reliquias de la inundacion.
					
					Entre tanto, en la provincia de Hamgyong del Sur se repararon el techo, la pared, el suelo de tablas, las tres puertas y otras piezas de la Capilla Taeung y el Pabellon Pogwang del Templo Kwangje del distrito de Pukchong, la Ermita Pulji del distrito de Yonggwang y otros edificios historicos y se repinto el Tanchong manteniendo el sentido arcaico.
					
					Esta campana, que cada ano se impulsa regularmente en Corea, es una buena ocasion para defender la nacionalidad e infundir el patriotismo en los trabajadores.

articles.title: Fabricada en Corea nueva bomba de agua
articles.content:
Fabricada en Corea nueva bomba de agua
  Pyongyang, 3 de diciembre (ATCC) -- Recientemente, la Academia Estatal de Ciencias de Corea invento una bomba de agua de nuevo tipo que ya esta en boga entre sus usuarios.
					  Ella bombea el agua aprovechando el fenomeno hidraulico que se produce cuando se bloquea momentaneamente el fluido del agua en el tubo.
					
					  El nuevo invento nombrado como "bomba hidraulica" tiene estructura simple, es facil de fabricar y dura mucho.
					
					  Funciona en cualquier parte donde haya el desnivel de mas de 1 m y puede bombear el agua a la altura de decenas de metros sin consumir la electricidad ni combustible.
					
					  Se usa ahora en varias unidades mostrando su gran eficiencia.
